title: How to Get Married in Thailand (as a Foreigner)

steps.title: Obtain an Affirmation of Freedom to Marry from the respective embassy or consulate in Bangkok.
steps.content: Obtain an Affirmation of Freedom to Marry from the respective embassy or consulate in Bangkok. This affidavit will state that you are free to marry. [1] X Trustworthy Source Official UK government website Official website for the public sector of the UK government Go to source If the foreigner is marrying another foreigner, depending on the nationality each of the couple's country must issue an affidavit that states you are free to marry. Requirements to secure the affidavit depends on the nationality. Commonly, valid passport has to be presented. If you are divorced or a had previous marriage has been terminated by spousal death, the original copy of divorce or death certificate must be provided. If the foreigner is marrying a Thai citizen, Thai National Identification Card and House Registration Document (blue book) is required.

steps.title: Translate the Affirmation of Freedom to Marry to the language you speak natively.
steps.content: Translate the Affirmation of Freedom to Marry to the language you speak natively. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Legalize Affirmation of Freedom to Marry at the Ministry of Foreign Affairs.
steps.content: Legalize Affirmation of Freedom to Marry at the Ministry of Foreign Affairs. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Register the marriage at the local district office (Amphur).
steps.content: Register the marriage at the local district office (Amphur). Submitting the documents and recording the marriage at the amphur validates the marriage and is legally binding. [4] X Research source

steps.title: The marriage certificates written in Thai will be issued.
steps.content: The marriage certificates written in Thai will be issued. [5] X Research source

steps.content: Certify the translation at the Ministry of Foreign Affairs. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Report the marriage to the foreigner's home state or country's embassy.
steps.content: Report the marriage to the foreigner's home state or country's embassy. You can also consulate in Thailand.
